moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/04 Algorithmic Reality/Understanding the Algorithm

overview.quote: The algorithm isn't some deity—it's just code designed to keep users watching.
overview.introText: Demystifying the 'black box' that determines content visibility and understanding what the algorithm really is: a matching service between content and viewers.

keyTerms.definition: Software that matches content to users based on engagement metrics to maximize time spent on platform.
Data points like likes, comments, shares, and watch time that algorithms use to evaluate content.
Misconception that algorithms are unknowable entities, when they simply follow patterns of human behavior.
Content distribution to users who don't follow you, based on algorithm's prediction of their interest.

actionPlan: Think of algorithm as a matchmaker, not a judge
Watch top-performing content in your niche
Practice describing your content to a distracted friend
Analyze when your content performs below average

mainContent.title: The Algorithm Is Just Code
mainContent.text: The algorithm isn't a mysterious deity—it's software designed with one goal: keeping users on the platform as long as possible by matching them with content they'll engage with.

mainContent.title: You Control The Algorithm
mainContent.text: The algorithm needs YOUR content to function. It's desperate for videos that hold attention, which means creators who understand viewer psychology have all the power.

mainContent.title: Algorithms Mirror Humans
mainContent.text: When your content struggles 'with the algorithm,' it's actually struggling with human attention. The algorithm simply reflects what people want to watch and engage with.

proTips.text: The first 200 viewers determine your video's fate—treat every post like it's being judged by a small jury of distracted users.
Controversial content often outperforms 'safe' content because algorithms can't distinguish between positive and negative engagement.

finalWords.description: Create content for distracted humans, not mysterious code, and the algorithm will follow.
